isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - DISASSEMBLE - INPUT SHAFT, BEARING CAGE, OIL PUMP AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

svcproc.title: INPUT SHAFT, BEARING CAGE, OIL PUMP AND INTER-AXLE DIFFERENTIAL

figure.caption: Figure 42. Input Shaft, Bearing Cage, Oil Pump and Inter-Axle Differential

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. OIL BAFFLE - UNITS WITHOUT OIL PUMP
12. OIL PUMP - UNITS WITH OIL PUMP

step1.para: Use a suitable tool to remove the yoke or flange from the input shaft ( Figure 43). If the carrier is not equipped with an oil pump, remove the bearing cage from the input shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove Yoke or Flange From Input Shaft

step1.para: Pry under the flange of the oil seal to remove the oil seal from the input bearing cage. Replace with new oil seal when assembling ( Figure 44).

figure.caption: Figure 44. Pry Under Flange of Oil Seal

warning.para: Wear safety glasses to prevent serious personal injury when servicing snap rings.

step1.para: Remove the snap ring that fastens the inter-axle differential assembly to the input shaft. Remove the inter-axle differential assembly from the input shaft ( Figure 45).

figure.caption: Figure 45. Remove Snap Ring Fastening Inter-Axle Differential Assembly to Input Shaft

note.para: Disassemble the inter-axle differential on 160 Series carriers only if any of the components are damaged and must be replaced. The inter-axle differential of the 140 and 145 Series carrier is serviced as an assembly and cannot be disassembled.

step1.para: Disassemble the 160 series inter-axle differential case according to the following procedure.

step2.para: Use a punch and a hammer to put an alignment mark on each half on the inter-axle differential case. The alignment marks make sure that the case halves are correctly installed ( Figure 46).

figure.caption: Figure 46. Mark Each Half on Inter-Axle Differential Case

step2.para: Remove the bolts that fasten the case halves of the inter-axle differential. Separate the case halves.
Remove the spider assembly from the case halves. Remove the four pinion gears and the four thrust washers from the spider.

step1.para: Remove the helical drive gear from the input shaft. Remove the thrust washer from the gear ( Figure 47).

note.para: Two oil pump designs are used: a "drive-flat" design and a spline design.

step1.para: If an oil pump is used, remove the input bearing cage and the oil pump from the input shaft. See the following procedure.

caution.para: Use the following procedure. If the procedure is not followed, the oil pump or the bearing cage will be damaged during removal. Pressure must never be applied directly to the surface of the pump or the bearing cage.

step2.para: Put a bearing puller under the oil pump. Make sure the rivets on the back of the pump do not touch the bearing puller. The bearing puller provides a level surface so that the shaft can be pressed straight out of the assembly ( Figure 48).

figure.caption: Figure 48. Put Bearing Puller Under Oil Pump

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.

step2.para: Put the assembly on a press so that it rests on the puller ( Figure 49).
Put a protector on top of the threaded part of the shaft. Press the input shaft from the assembly. Remove the bearing puller ( Figure 49).
Remove the bolts that fasten the oil pump to the input bearing cage. Separate the oil pump from the cage ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Separate Oil Pump From Cage

step2.para: Replace the pump, if the pump is worn, damaged or the drive flats or the splines in the pump do not move.

step1.para: Remove the O-rings from the bearing cage and, if used, the oil pump assembly.
Remove the cone from the input bearing cage.

note.para: If either the bearing cup or cone needs replacement, both parts must be replaced in a matched set.

step1.para: If necessary, use a press and a sleeve to remove the cup from the input bearing cage.
If necessary, remove the pressure relief valve assembly from the front of the bearing cage. Remove the plug, the spring and the relief valve from the bore ( Figure 51).

figure.caption: Figure 51. Remove Plug, Spring, and Relief Valve

step1.para: Remove the oil screen and plug assembly from the suction line at the front of carrier ( Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Remove Oil Screen and Plug Assembly

step1.para: Clean the oil screen. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT.
